reinforcements.similarity: Both address the critical human-to-digital handoff gap. Library works-004 (Bridge Human Trust to Digital Trust Through Continuity Priming) identifies that the host's trust is built with the agent, not the platform, and prescribes explicit priming during the call and agent-referenced first-touch screens. New works-006 (Eliminate the Post-Call Engagement Gap with Synchronous Activation) arrives at the same conclusion from a different angle: the post-call gap is the highest-risk engagement decay window and the solution is sending a proposal link during the call itself.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence: Andreas's call ends with email exchange and a promise to follow up; the platform is never mentioned (andreas-call.txt, 5:27-6:11). New evidence: Jason's call ends with 'I'll follow up with an email shortly' (jason-call.txt, 13:59) -- the identical gap, now observed in a second host call. Kahneman's priming research (library) and Cagan's speed-as-advantage principle (new) converge: the handoff must be synchronous, not asynchronous. Two independent lenses, two independent theoretical frameworks, same conclusion.

reinforcements.similarity: Both address the System 1 trust gate at the evaluation-to-commitment transition. Library works-001 (System 1 Trust Gate at Every Phase Transition) prescribes visual consistency, familiar language, and explicit connection to prior phases. New works-003 (Accommodate the Traditional Landlord Mental Model) identifies a specific failure mode: when the platform's process diverges from the host's entrenched expectations (in-person showings, direct income verification), the trust gate fails because the new context contradicts the host's associative network rather than extending it.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence: the first 2 seconds of every new screen must signal continuity (Kahneman's associative coherence). New evidence: Jason's showing concern escalates from 'a bit odd' (10:50) to 'this just sounds weird' (12:35) because the platform's process triggered System 1 suspicion rather than coherence. Cagan (Ch. 2) adds: the best products blend online and offline, they do not replace offline expectations. The new element extends the library's abstract trust-gate principle with a concrete failure mode and remedy: bridge the traditional mental model before introducing the platform model.

reinforcements.similarity: Both address the gap between what the host needs to know and what the platform provides during evaluation. Library works-003 (Match the Platform's Cognitive Speed to the Phone Call's Conversational Speed) identifies that the call is fast and the platform is slow. New works-001 (Proactive Data Readiness for Host Evaluation Questions) identifies a specific speed failure: the agent could not answer Jason's income question in real time, and the platform has no mechanism to surface this data proactively.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence: Andreas describes two units in 7 seconds; the platform must match this density. New evidence: Jason asks about combined income (06:14) and gets 'I'd have to look that up' (06:21). Both identify speed-of-information as a conversion driver. The new element narrows the library's broad speed principle into an actionable prescription: pre-assemble evaluation data packets containing the 5-7 questions hosts predictably ask.

reinforcements.similarity: Both address the challenge of maintaining host engagement across a depleting multi-step journey. Library works-002 (Design for the Depleted User at Every Step After the First) uses Kahneman's ego depletion framework. New works-002 (Conversion Runway Compression Against Competitive Alternatives) uses Cagan's startup-as-race framework. Both conclude that every hour of delay costs conversion, but from different angles: the library focuses on cognitive depletion within the platform, the new element focuses on competitive alternatives outside the platform.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence: the parole judge study -- depleted decision-makers default to denial. New evidence: Jason has 6 showings and guests are considering other places (13:26) -- delay is not just cognitively costly but competitively fatal. The combined insight is that conversion pressure is both internal (cognitive depletion within the platform) and external (competitive alternatives outside the platform), and the platform must address both simultaneously.

reinforcements.similarity: Both leverage the host's natural expertise-sharing behavior as a commitment mechanism. Library works-005 (Engineer the Host-as-Advisor Moment) identifies that when the host shifts from evaluator to advisor, they psychologically commit. New works-004 (Capture Offline Operational Knowledge as a Platform Asset) identifies the same behavior: Jason voluntarily shares 3 minutes of parking expertise and preemptively flags furniture conditions -- he is advising, not being interrogated.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence: Andreas shifts to advisor mode at 5:12 when he says 'if they just go there to sleep, I think just a bed.' New evidence: Jason spends 03:15-05:14 volunteering detailed parking logistics without being asked. Both hosts naturally shift into expertise-sharing mode when given conversational space. The new element operationalizes the library's commitment insight into a concrete platform feature: structured operational knowledge capture that channels the host's advisory instinct into a persistent, guest-facing asset.

reinforcements.similarity: Both address how trust signals should be structured in the host-facing information architecture. Library communicates-003 (Trust Credential Stack: Process Before Promise) prescribes mechanism-first, conclusion-second ordering for trust claims. New communicates-001 (Trust-Signal-First Hierarchy for Host Evaluation Screens) prescribes placing traditional landlord trust signals (income, credit, references) at the top of the visual hierarchy.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence: Bryant explains the guarantee mechanism before stating the guarantee (andreas-call.txt, 3:28-3:51). New evidence: Jason's very first question is about income (06:14) -- the most traditional trust signal. Both elements agree that trust signals must lead the information hierarchy, but the library focuses on ordering within trust signals (mechanism before promise) while the new element focuses on where trust signals sit relative to other content (trust signals before logistics). The combined prescription is: trust signals first on screen, mechanism before promise within each signal.

reinforcements.similarity: Both address how the first digital touchpoint should be structured to maintain engagement. Library communicates-001 (Anchor-Then-Advance) prescribes opening every screen with what the host already knows. New communicates-006 (Synchronous Activation Link During Call) prescribes a specific first-touch screen that shows the proposal summary sent during the call.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence: recognition is effortless, comprehension is effortful -- lead with recognition (Kahneman's associative coherence). New evidence: the first-touch screen must show property address, guest names, and financial summary -- all recognition anchors from the call conversation. The new element is a concrete application of the library's abstract anchor-then-advance principle to the highest-risk moment in the journey (the call-to-digital handoff).

reinforcements.similarity: Both address how proposals should be structured for host evaluation. Library communicates-005 (Pre-Packaged Proposal) prescribes presenting proposals as confirmable packages rather than negotiation starting points. New communicates-003 (Progressive Proposal Disclosure Aligned to Decision Sequence) prescribes structuring the proposal in the host's cognitive decision order: financials first, terms second, operational details third.
reinforcements.combined_evidence: Library evidence: Bryant presents the proposal as a pre-packaged deal the host can confirm (andreas-call.txt, 1:58-2:19). New evidence: Jason's question sequence maps a strict decision tree -- money (06:14), time (06:43), stuff (07:55), trust (10:18). The library focuses on packaging (complete, confirmable), the new element focuses on sequencing (financial gate first). Combined: proposals should be both pre-packaged (library) and progressively disclosed in decision-tree order (new).

contradictions.conflict: A potential tension exists between the library's prescription to maintain visual and process continuity at every transition (works-001: anchor in familiar patterns) and the new element's prescription to accommodate the traditional landlord mental model even when it diverges from the platform's process (works-003: facilitate showings if the host wants them). The library element optimizes for consistent platform experience; the new element argues the platform should bend to accommodate offline expectations. If the platform facilitates showings for some hosts (per works-003) but not others, the visual and process consistency that works-001 demands may be violated.
contradictions.evidence_comparison: The library's evidence is theoretical (Kahneman's associative coherence) while the new evidence is behavioral (Jason's escalating showing concern across two mentions). The behavioral evidence is stronger because it shows what actually happens when the consistency principle encounters a real host with real expectations. The library's principle holds in general, but the new element identifies a specific exception: when the platform's consistent process contradicts the host's deeply held norms, consistency creates alienation rather than coherence.
contradictions.recommendation: Resolve by making accommodation the consistent pattern. The platform should consistently offer the option to accommodate traditional expectations at every divergence point, making the accommodation itself the consistent experience. This preserves the library's continuity principle while implementing the new element's flexibility principle.

extensions.gap_filled: Configurable listing state for negotiable property attributes. The existing library has no element addressing the reality that property attributes (furniture, cleaning, configuration) are often conditional and negotiable rather than fixed. This is entirely new territory covering listing_creation and proposal_mgmt phases.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens (jason-call + inspired). Evidence is strong from the call (Jason explicitly offers to customize furniture and ties cleaning to tenant preferences) but has not been corroborated by a second host call. The pattern may be specific to furnished listings. Medium confidence.

extensions.gap_filled: Mental Model Bridge pattern for process divergences. The library has no element that prescribes how to handle moments where the platform's process contradicts the host's traditional expectations. This is a new information architecture pattern (acknowledge, explain, protect) that fills a gap across evaluation, onboarding, and proposal_mgmt phases.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens, but the evidence is very strong: Jason repeats his showing concern twice with escalating language, demonstrating that unaddressed divergences compound. Cagan's framework independently validates the need to accommodate rather than override user expectations. High confidence despite single lens.

extensions.gap_filled: Operational knowledge capture through guided conversational prompts. The library's communicates-004 (Seven-Second Unit Description) addresses speed of listing creation but not the capture of rich operational knowledge (parking, building rules, furniture conditions) that exists only in the host's memory. This new element fills that gap.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens. Jason's 3-minute parking tutorial provides strong evidence, but the extent to which other hosts possess and would share similar operational knowledge is unvalidated. Medium confidence.

extensions.gap_filled: Configurable attribute disclosure pattern for negotiable property state. The library has no information architecture for expressing item-level furniture states (included/available/removable) with condition notes. This extends the listing_creation and proposal_mgmt coverage.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens. Directly tied to works-005 evidence. Medium confidence -- the pattern assumes hosts like Jason (willing to customize) are representative.

extensions.gap_filled: Competitive context transparency for time-sensitive decisions. The library has no element addressing how to surface factual competitive information (guest decision timelines, proposal age) to help hosts calibrate their decision timing. This fills a gap in the proposal_mgmt and evaluation phases.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens. Jason proactively asks about competitive alternatives (13:20), which is strong behavioral evidence that hosts want this information. But the appropriate visual treatment (neutral vs. urgent) needs validation. Medium confidence.

extensions.gap_filled: The entire looks layer is new territory -- the existing library has no visual pattern elements. All seven looks elements (looks-001 through looks-007) represent the first visual implementation guidance in the library, covering financial typography hierarchy, mental model bridge callouts, progressive proposal sections, mobile first-touch screens, furniture inventory grids, competitive context badges, and house manual cards.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens. The visual patterns are well-grounded in the tokens.json system and the taste model, but have not been validated against a second lens or against actual implementation. High confidence on direction, medium confidence on specific token values.

extensions.gap_filled: The entire behaves layer is new territory -- the existing library has no interaction pattern elements. All seven behaves elements (behaves-001 through behaves-007) represent the first interaction design guidance in the library, covering optimistic proposal link delivery, progressive data readiness, mental model bridge deployment, configurable furniture negotiation, competitive context timelines, operational knowledge capture, and proposal decision sequence gating.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens. Interaction patterns are grounded in both the host call and Cagan's product discovery framework. State definitions and edge cases are thorough. Medium-high confidence.

extensions.gap_filled: The entire feels layer is new territory -- the existing library has no emotional element types. All seven feels elements (feels-001 through feels-007) represent the first emotional design guidance in the library, covering validated expertise recognition, momentum preservation, respectful divergence, precision-backed calm, collaborative ownership, grounded urgency, and proud expertise sharing.
extensions.confidence_note: Single lens. Emotional targets are well-evidenced from Jason's call (his escalating language patterns, his pride in property knowledge, his financial evaluation anxiety). Copy guidelines and anti-patterns are specific and actionable. Medium-high confidence.

new_tokens_flagged: typography-scale-financial (looks-001): a defined type scale for financial data display (24/18/14 hierarchy) -- not in tokens.json
spacing-data-isolation (looks-001): minimum whitespace around data-critical elements -- not in tokens.json
border-accent-left (looks-002): 3px left-border in accent color for contextual callouts -- not in tokens.json
surface-bridge (looks-002): dedicated background for mental model bridge callouts -- not in tokens.json
shadow-section-primary (looks-003): more prominent shadow for top-priority proposal sections -- not in tokens.json
bg-cascade (looks-003): named three-step surface cascade for progressive disclosure -- not in tokens.json
layout-first-touch (looks-004): single-viewport layout constraint for time-critical screens -- not in tokens.json
cta-primary-height (looks-004): minimum 48px touch target for primary CTA -- not in tokens.json
state-dot-included (looks-005): 8px circle in accent for included state -- not in tokens.json
state-dot-available (looks-005): 8px circle in signal-info for available state -- not in tokens.json
state-dot-removable (looks-005): 8px circle in ink-ghost for removable state -- not in tokens.json
row-highlight-request (looks-005): left-border + background for pending change requests -- not in tokens.json
ink-muted-to-soft-transition (looks-006): color transition triggered after 48hr inactivity -- not in tokens.json
timeline-mono-inline (looks-006): convention for mono date fragments within sans context -- not in tokens.json
border-dashed-prompt (looks-007): dashed border for empty-state cards with prompts -- not in tokens.json
icon-category-operational (looks-007): 5-icon set for house manual card headers -- not in tokens.json
token_compliance.recommendation: Add cta-primary-height (48px min touch target) immediately as it addresses WCAG 2.5.5 compliance. Add typography-scale-financial as a named scale since financial data appears across multiple elements and consistency matters. Add bg-cascade as a named pattern since the three-step surface cascade (surface > surface-warm > bg) is used by multiple looks elements. The remaining tokens are element-specific conventions that can be added when those elements are implemented. None of the proposed tokens conflict with existing tokens.json values -- they extend the system with domain-specific refinements.

arc_conflicts: Evaluation phase carries competing emotional demands: feels-001 targets confidence (validated expertise recognition) while feels-003 targets safety (respectful divergence at expectation clashes). These are not contradictory but require careful sequencing: confidence must be established before divergence is introduced. If the host encounters a process divergence before their expertise is validated, the safety mechanism has no foundation. The emotional sequence must be: confidence first (present data in their language), then safety (acknowledge the divergence), then calm (show precise financials).

Proposal_mgmt phase asks for both clarity (feels-006: grounded urgency through transparent timelines) and ownership (feels-005: collaborative configuration). There is a risk that timeline pressure undermines the collaborative feel: if the host is configuring furniture while seeing 'guests decide by Friday,' the urgency may rush the collaboration. Resolution: timeline context should be ambient and subordinate to the collaboration interface, not competing for attention during active configuration.
emotional_arc_check.arc_assessment: The emotional arc from this lens makes sense end-to-end and complements the existing library's cognitive framework. The library (Kahneman lens) focuses on System 1/System 2 cognitive load; the new elements (Cagan lens) add emotional targets that humanize the cognitive principles. The arc follows a coherent progression: curiosity (discovery) to confidence and calm (evaluation) to momentum (onboarding) to pride and ownership (listing/proposal) to clarity (decision). The most critical emotional transition is evaluation-to-onboarding, where momentum must be preserved through synchronous activation -- this is the emotional equivalent of the library's System 1 trust gate. The arc has one notable gap: no feels elements specifically target the active_lease or retention phases, leaving those phases emotionally unspecified. Future lenses should address the emotional experience of hosts during an active lease (likely: security, peace of mind) and at retention decision points (likely: recognition, loyalty).

loop_back_recommendations.reason: Looks-006 (Competitive Context Timeline Badge) specifies ink-muted text on bg background at default state, which achieves only 2.9:1 contrast ratio -- below WCAG AA. The element acknowledges this but defers resolution to accessibility audits. This should be resolved now, not deferred.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: Specify ink-soft (#4a4640) as the default badge color instead of ink-muted, achieving 6.9:1 contrast. Reserve the further darkening to ink (#1a1714) for the 48-hour escalation. Update looks-006 tokens accordingly.

loop_back_recommendations.reason: Looks-007 (Operational Knowledge House Manual Card System) specifies empty-state prompts in ink-muted at 14px, achieving approximately 4.0:1 contrast which marginally misses WCAG AA (4.5:1 for normal text). The element suggests darkening the prompt color or increasing font size.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: Use ink-soft (#4a4640) for empty-state prompts instead of ink-muted, achieving 10.4:1 contrast. This maintains the visual subordination to filled content (which uses ink at 16.8:1) while meeting accessibility requirements.

loop_back_recommendations.reason: The feels layer has no elements targeting the active_lease or retention phases, leaving the emotional experience of established hosts unspecified. The journey-context.json identifies active_lease dropout risk as medium and retention dropout risk as high.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: A future lens should produce feels elements for active_lease (target emotions: security, peace of mind when property is occupied by vetted guests) and retention (target emotions: recognition of host investment, loyalty through demonstrated platform value over time). Jason's call provides preliminary signals: his anticipatory concern about guest complaints (08:36) suggests active-lease anxiety, and his zero switching cost to Craigslist (13:31) suggests retention requires earned loyalty.

loop_back_recommendations.reason: The discovery phase has thin coverage (3 elements across the combined library). Both host calls were initiated through Craigslist outreach, meaning the discovery phase is entirely agent-mediated with no product touchpoint. The platform has no discovery-phase product.
loop_back_recommendations.new_input: A future lens should specifically target the discovery phase with a book extract on marketplace growth or network effects. The current evidence suggests Split Lease is in 'concierge discovery' mode (Cagan Ch. 3) and needs a product-led discovery pathway. A lens pairing a different host call (one where the host found Split Lease organically, if such a call exists) with a growth-focused book extract would fill this gap.
